feed.title: Celina Chang
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: WeMesh Presskit
entry.content: As a UI/UX Designer at WeMesh (rebranded as Rave), I was tasked with designing and implementing the presskit for the company's website. I used Bootstrap and JavaScript/JQuery to implement the webpage. Below is a quick snapshot of the presskit.
entry.summary: As a UI/UX Designer at WeMesh (rebranded as Rave), I was tasked with designing and implementing the presskit for the company's website. I used Bootstrap and JavaScript/JQuery to implement the webpage. Below is a quick snapshot of the presskit.

entry.title: Portfolio Design
entry.content:
Every co-op term, I usually redesign my personal website due to new design practices and mostly to apply new skills I have obtained or old skills that I have improved. This term, the focus of the portfolio design was of course, the portfolio content. I wanted more pictures and less words which I tried to convey in my old design, but unfortunately it was poorly executed.

My old personal website was a one-page website and used JQuery to swap content in and out. This time, I learned to use Jekyll to set up templates and make swapping content more efficient. Below are a couple of mockups of potential portfolio designs created with Sketch.
entry.summary: Every co-op term, I usually redesign my personal website due to new design practices and mostly to apply new skills I have obtained or old skills that I have improved. This term, the focus of the portfolio design was of course, the portfolio content. I wanted more pictures and less words which I tried to convey in my old design, but unfortunately it was poorly executed.

entry.title: Odin with Friends
entry.content:
Odin with Friends is a hackathon project that I participated in when I was a QA Engineer Co-op at Zynga Inc. It was a 3 day project. The concept of the game was based on the office dog, Odin. The team decided to based the game off of Flappy Bird. As a result, Odin with Friends became a multiplayer version of Flappy Bird with the addition of horizontal controls. Players can propel themselves forward or backgrounds in addition to jumping over obstacles.

My role in Odin with Friends was the visual appearance of the game and creating game assets such as sprites, backgrounds, obstacles, splashscreen, and more. The husky on the left (or above if on mobile) is Odin, as well as the app icon.

The visual style of the game was decided to be a pixel style to reflect on the style of Flappy Bird and due to time constraints. This was my first attempt at pixel art. Below is the home screen to Odin with Friends and the background of the game.

I used Photoshop to create all the assets as well as the homescreen and background. The gif animation of Odin was done with 3 frames in Photoshop. Odin was then edited to make a second player, a shibainu. Below are mockups of the game screens.
entry.summary: Odin with Friends is a hackathon project that I participated in when I was a QA Engineer Co-op at Zynga Inc. It was a 3 day project. The concept of the game was based on the office dog, Odin. The team decided to based the game off of Flappy Bird. As a result, Odin with Friends became a multiplayer version of Flappy Bird with the addition of horizontal controls. Players can propel themselves forward or backgrounds in addition to jumping over obstacles. My role in Odin with Friends was the visual appearance of the game and creating game assets such as sprites, backgrounds, obstacles, splashscreen, and more. The husky on the left (or above if on mobile) is Odin, as well as the app icon.

entry.title: Spartans Speak
entry.content:
Spartans Speak is a North Surrey Secondary's school magazine club. My role at the club was Head Designer of the magazine that we produced bi-monthly. I had full control over the design of the magazine. My duties included planning out the full layout of each issue, finding assets, taking photos, and deciding how articles are ordered. The magazines were designed with InDesign and Photoshop. You can view the November 2013 edition here.

This overall theme of this edition focused on the school colours: red, black, and white. The design of each article was tailored to its content. Below are some page layouts designed in the November 2013 Edition.
entry.summary: Spartans Speak is a North Surrey Secondary's school magazine club. My role at the club was Head Designer of the magazine that we produced bi-monthly. I had full control over the design of the magazine. My duties included planning out the full layout of each issue, finding assets, taking photos, and deciding how articles are ordered. The magazines were designed with InDesign and Photoshop. You can view the November 2013 edition here.
